title: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
summary: A rich, slow-cooked beef and tomato sauce served over a bed of al dente spaghetti. A comforting family favorite.
instructions: 1. Brown beef and drain fat.
2. Add onion and cook until soft.
3. Stir in tomatoes and spices; simmer for 1 hour.
4. Serve over cooked spaghetti.

title: Simple Chicken Stir-Fry
summary: Tender chicken and crisp, colorful vegetables tossed in a savory ginger-soy sauce. Quick and healthy weeknight meal.
instructions: 1. Cut chicken and vegetables.
2. Stir-fry chicken until done.
3. Add vegetables and cook until crisp-tender.
4. Pour in sauce mixture and serve immediately.

title: Creamy Tomato Soup
summary: Velvety smooth tomato soup, perfect for pairing with a grilled cheese sandwich. Ready in under 30 minutes.
instructions: 1. Sauté onion in a pot.
2. Add tomatoes and broth; simmer for 15 minutes.
3. Stir in cream and spices.
4. Heat gently and serve with fresh basil.

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Salmon
summary: Flaky salmon fillets baked with fresh lemon slices, rosemary, and thyme. An elegant and light dinner option.
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Place salmon on a baking sheet and drizzle with oil.
3. Top with lemon and herbs.
4. Bake for 12-15 minutes until flaky.

title: Vegetarian Chili
summary: Hearty and spiced chili packed with beans, corn, and bell peppers. A satisfying, meat-free alternative.
instructions: 1. Sauté onion and pepper.
2. Stir in spices.
3. Add beans and tomatoes; simmer for 20 minutes.
4. Serve with your favorite toppings.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
summary: The ultimate breakfast classic. Light, tall pancakes ready to be topped with butter and maple syrup.
instructions: 1. Whisk dry ingredients.
2. Whisk wet ingredients separately.
3. Combine wet and dry, mixing lightly.
4. Cook on a hot, oiled griddle until bubbles form.

title: Beef Tacos al Pastor
summary: Marinated beef (or pork) grilled with pineapple and served in soft corn tortillas with fresh cilantro and onion.
instructions: 1. Marinate meat for at least 30 minutes.
2. Grill meat and pineapple until cooked through.
3. Chop meat and serve on warm tortillas.
4. Garnish with cilantro and onion.

title: Garlic Butter Shrimp Scampi
summary: Shrimp sautéed in a rich sauce of butter, garlic, white wine, and lemon, typically served over linguine.
instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package directions.
2. Sauté garlic in butter.
3. Add shrimp and cook until pink.
4. Deglaze with wine and lemon juice.
5. Toss with cooked pasta.

title: Homemade Pizza Dough
summary: The foundational recipe for a perfect, chewy, homemade pizza crust. Requires basic ingredients and time to rise.
instructions: 1. Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water.
2. Combine flour and salt.
3. Mix wet and dry ingredients.
4. Knead, then let rise for 1-1.5 hours.
5. Punch down and shape.

title: Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Frosting
summary: Soft, sticky, and sweet rolls filled with cinnamon and topped with a decadent cream cheese glaze.
instructions: 1. Prepare and knead dough; let rise.
2. Roll out dough and spread filling.
3. Roll tightly and slice.
4. Bake until golden; top with frosting while warm.

title: Lentil Soup
summary: A warming and nutritious soup featuring brown lentils, carrots, and celery in a savory vegetable broth.
instructions: 1. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery.
2. Add lentils, broth, and bay leaf.
3. Simmer until lentils are tender (about 30 minutes).
4. Remove bay leaf and serve.

title: Avocado Toast with Everything Bagel Seasoning
summary: A quick and trendy breakfast or snack: smashed avocado on toasted bread, sprinkled with savory seasoning.
instructions: 1. Toast bread until golden.
2. Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread on toast.
4. Sprinkle generously with seasoning.

title: Thai Green Curry
summary: A fragrant and spicy curry with chicken or tofu, simmered in coconut milk with bamboo shoots and Thai basil.
instructions: 1. Heat coconut milk and curry paste.
2. Add chicken/tofu and cook through.
3. Add vegetables and simmer until tender.
4. Stir in basil and fish sauce before serving with rice.

title: Classic Beef Burger
summary: The ultimate backyard burger with a juicy beef patty, fresh lettuce, tomato, and cheese on a toasted bun.
instructions: 1. Form beef into four patties; season well.
2. Grill patties until desired doneness.
3. Place cheese on top to melt.
4. Serve on toasted buns with toppings.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Chewy centers, crisp edges, and melted chocolate chips—the perfect batch of comforting homemade cookies.
instructions: 1. Cream butter and sugars.
2. Beat in egg and vanilla.
3. Mix in flour and baking soda.
4. Fold in chocolate chips.
5. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 9-11 minutes.

title: Pesto Pasta Salad
summary: Cold pasta tossed with bright green pesto, cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and pine nuts. Great for picnics.
instructions: 1. Cook pasta and rinse with cold water.
2. In a large bowl, combine pasta, pesto, tomatoes, and mozzarella.
3. Toss gently to combine.
4. Chill before serving; garnish with pine nuts.

title: Breakfast Burrito
summary: Scrambled eggs, sausage, cheese, and potatoes wrapped in a warm tortilla. Fully customizable and filling.
instructions: 1. Cook eggs, sausage, and potatoes.
2. Warm tortillas.
3. Layer filling ingredients onto tortillas.
4. Fold into burritos and serve warm.

title: Homemade Falafel
summary: Crispy, spiced chickpea patties, often served in a pita with tahini sauce and fresh vegetables.
instructions: 1. Blend chickpeas, onion, herbs, and spices.
2. Form mixture into patties.
3. Fry or bake until golden brown and crispy.
4. Serve in pita bread with tahini.

title: Baked Macaroni and Cheese
summary: Creamy, cheesy elbow macaroni topped with breadcrumbs and baked until golden brown and bubbly.
instructions: 1. Make roux with butter and flour; add milk.
2. Stir in cheese until melted.
3. Mix with cooked macaroni.
4. Transfer to baking dish, top with breadcrumbs, and bake.

title: French Onion Soup
summary: Rich beef broth featuring caramelized onions, topped with a large crouton and a thick layer of melted Gruyère cheese.
instructions: 1. Slowly caramelize onions (about 45 minutes).
2. Add wine, broth, and seasonings; simmer.
3. Pour into oven-safe bowls, top with bread and cheese.
4. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly.
